verses.name: Psalms 40:5
verses.text: Many, O Lord my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.

verses.name: Psalms 40:6
verses.text: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.

verses.name: Psalms 40:7
verses.text: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,

verses.name: Psalms 40:8
verses.text: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
